item.title: Fair warnings
item.description: Occasionally, I’m asked I’m a particular Lance Leonard. I’ll admit to being a Lance Leonard, but perhaps not the Lance Leonard you’re looking for. (“Haven’t you heard? I come in six-packs.”) For example, I am not: A conservative politician from New Jersey. (You’ve likely reversed the names, not to mention the, well, never mind. It’s not that sort of site.) Formerly of any confection or beverage companies; the email addresses are close, but different.

item.title: Privacy policy
item.description: I don’t track you or how you use the site. I don’t record any personally identifying information (PII). No cookies are saved to your device, so there’s nothing to opt in to. At some point, I may add analytics to help understand how people (in general) use the site. When I do that, I’ll update things accordingly. If I learn you stopped by, I’ll keep that to myself. Since I’m not tracking anything, there’s nothing to share, sell, delete, or otherwise abuse.

item.title: The site name
item.description: A paradox? A paradox, A most ingenious paradox! We’ve quips and quibbles heard in flocks! But none to beat this paradox! – Ruth & Frederic, “The Pirates of Penzance”, Act II (Scene 19), by W.S. Gilbert & Arthur Sullivan, 1879 The site’s name is based, in part, on lyrics from The Pirates of Penzance. (It’s also a subtle nod to one of my earliest documentation roles and, yes, there’s a small story or few.
